    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer​(java.lang.String newNickname, VirtualView playerView) throws InvalidSelectionException
      Adds a new player to the game
      Parameters:
      newNickname - The nickname of the player to be added
      Throws:
      InvalidSelectionException - if the player's name is already in use

    • setCurrentPlayerIndex

      public void setCurrentPlayerIndex​(java.lang.Integer currentPlayerIndex)

    • initGame

      public void initGame()
      Sends game information to players and starts the first turn. Called only at the starting of the game

    • removeTurnPlayer

      public void removeTurnPlayer()
      Removes the turnPlayer from the game and ends the game if there's only one player left

    • endGame

      public void endGame()
      Stops the game and kills the server. Called after a player's victory

    • setNextTurnPlayer

      public void setNextTurnPlayer()
      Changes the current turnPlayer to the next one. Called after the end of the turn

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getGodPowers()

      godPowers - A list of strings representing god names

      public void removeGodPowerFromAvailableGods​(java.lang.String selectedGod)

    • runPhase

      public void runPhase​(java.lang.String inputString) throws IllegalFormatException, InvalidSelectionException
      Runs the currentPhase of the game
      Parameters:
      inputString - usually indicates a cell's position, it may indicate actions or constructible items
      Throws:
      IllegalFormatException - when the inpuString can't be parsed
      InvalidSelectionException - when the inputString is parsed to a non-permitted action

    • assignSelectedGodPowerToPlayer

      public void assignSelectedGodPowerToPlayer​(java.lang.String selectedGod, java.lang.String choosingPlayer) throws InvalidSelectionException
      Assigns the god passed as a String representing its name to the player passed as a String representing their nickname
      Parameters:
      selectedGod - A String representing the god's name
      choosingPlayer - A String representing the player's nickname
      Throws:
      InvalidSelectionException

    • isTurnPlayer

      public java.lang.Boolean isTurnPlayer​(java.lang.String nickname)

      nickname - A String representing a nickname
      Returns:
      true if the nickname belongs to the turnPlayer

    • getNthPlayer

      public java.lang.String getNthPlayer​(java.lang.Integer index)
      Returns the nickname of the nth player
      Parameters:
      index - An Integer representing the position of a player (order criterion: login time)
      Returns:
      The nickname of the nth player

    • initGods

      public void initGods()
      Populates the game with all the existing Santorini gods and sends a List of their names as strings to the players

    • hasFreeSlots

      public java.lang.Boolean hasFreeSlots()
      Checks whether the current game can accept more players
      Returns:
      true if more players can join the game

    • haveAllPlayersConnected

      public java.lang.Boolean haveAllPlayersConnected()
      Checks whether the current game has reached the expected number of players, as decided by the challenger
      Returns:
      true if the expected number of players is reached

    • registerChallengerSelection

      public void registerChallengerSelection​(java.lang.Integer selectedStartingPlayerIndex, java.lang.Integer selectedNumberOfPlayers, java.util.List<java.lang.String> selectedGods) throws InvalidSelectionException
      Sets the starting player, the number of players and the gods that will be available in the game being created
      Parameters:
      selectedStartingPlayerIndex - The starting player index (challenger: 1, second player: 2, etc...)
      selectedNumberOfPlayers - The number of players to reach before the game can start
      selectedGods - The gods that will be available for the players to pick
      Throws:
      InvalidSelectionException - when the passed parameter are in conflict with each other

    • handleColorAndWorkerSelection

      public void handleColorAndWorkerSelection​(java.lang.String selectedColor, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> xCoordinates, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> yCoordinates) throws InvalidSelectionException
      Sets the turnPlayer's color and creates the two gameworkers of theirs according to the specified coordinates
      Parameters:
      selectedColor - A String representing the chosen color
      xCoordinates - A List containing the x coordinate of the two workers expressed as Integers
      yCoordinates - A List containing the y coordinate of the two workers expressed as Integers
      Throws:
      InvalidSelectionException - when the passed parameter are in conflict with each other

    • isChallenger

      public java.lang.Boolean isChallenger​(java.lang.String nickname)
      Checks whether the passed nickname belongs to the challenger
      Parameters:
      nickname - A String representing the challenger's nickname
      Returns:
      true if the nickname belongs to the challenger

    • isReadyToStart

      public java.lang.Boolean isReadyToStart()
      Checks whether the current game is ready to start
      Returns:
      true if all the players have chosen their color and gameWorkers
